intro: Greigia mulfordii var. mulfordii, commonly known as the Florida greigia, is a rare and endangered plant species native to the southeastern United States. It is a member of the Asteraceae family, characterized by its composite flower heads and opposite, lance-shaped leaves. The plant produces small, yellowish flowers that bloom in the spring, followed by fruiting bodies that are distinctive in shape. It thrives in moist, sandy soils and is typically found in coastal dunes and wetlands. Due to habitat loss, it is critically endangered and requires conservation efforts to ensure its survival.
